content: Working with one of the IGs people have asked me to look at and an issue has come up that I'm not sure how to think about
if you have a resource with contained resources, the contained resources are never rendered - there's no place where the IG publisher can refer to them by
Is this about examples or about conformance resources (or both)?
particularly conformance resources. A good case is contained value sets

For examples, all we show now is narrative and the formal syntaxes. The narrative should cover the relevant bits of the narratives too. So the real issue is for the infrastructure resources where we don't show narrative and, perhaps, where a contained resource has a 'better' rendering available than the narrative. I guess we could create separate page sets for each contained resource and include links to them from the containing resource. We'd need to surface that in the table of contents (to handle section numbers properly - though that's going to be messy because right now the templates assume that resources can't have children...) However, if we make that bit work, then the breadcrumbs should work ok. It's not a bad idea. It's not critically urgent for any IGs I'm doing right now, though SDC does have several examples with contained value sets, so it'd certainly be a "nice-to-have".
I do not think that it needs to be in the table of contents
Section numbering is driven by the table of contents
... well... as of the next commit, there will be pages (one or 2) for each contained resource
How will they be surfaced in the IG or data files?
(Templates can't link to what they don't know about...)
